description: From Xerox (“a photocopier”) (originally a trademark), from xerography, from Ancient Greek ξηρός (xērós, “dry”) and γραφή (graphḗ, “writing”).

entries.meaning: (dated in North America, Philippines, colloquial, informal) A photocopy.
examples: Hand me that xerox, would you?

entries.meaning: (dated, Canada, US, colloquial, informal) A photocopier.

verbs.description: xerox (third-person singular simple present xeroxes, present participle xeroxing, simple past and past participle xeroxed)

entries.meaning: (dated, Canada, US, Philippines, colloquial, informal) To make a paper copy or copies by means of a photocopier.
examples: I xeroxed the report for all the people at the meeting.
